Title: ğŸ”¥ğŸš€[ANN] BlockSafe Technologies - Securing the Blockchain Ecosystem ğŸ”¥ğŸš€
Body: Hi Candycrush1129,  Blocksafe Technologies has worked with a number of legal advisers to establish the most appropriate legal framework within which to protect crypto assets without putting those assets at risk. There are certainly areas in which traditional legal principles need to apply without direct precedent to crypto assets, but in each case the extension of existing legal principles has been found to be unlikely to lead to unacceptable ambiguity. For the initial analysis, English law was used as the basis of analysis.  Best wishes, The BlockSafe Team

Author: joirgetinmim
Title: ğŸ”¥ğŸš€[ANN] BlockSafe Technologies - Securing the Blockchain Ecosystem ğŸ”¥ğŸš€
Body: Hi Freddy11,  Thanks for your time, Crypto currencies and the blockchain are under attack by hackers. $1.1 Billion has been stolen in the first six months of 2018. Our products offer a comprehensive solution to this problem using proven patented technologies. Two of our unique features include:  â—   Keystroke encryption: This feature prevents malware from spying on what you type. The keystrokes are secured between the kernel and the wallet application using military grade encryption. Now, the password you enter to logon or decrypt your secret key is safe. â—   Clipboard copy protection: This feature prevents malware from monitoring the clipboard to spy on, copy and paste the contents of the clipboard. So the destination address to which a crypto transaction is sent to is not modified.  We hope we've been able to clear your doubts.  Have a great week, The BlockSafe Team

Steve led the development of the IT Strategy for Homeland Security, guided the implementation of the unclassified and classified networks of the new department, oversaw the creation of the department's enterprise architecture, and provided the vision for the use of IT across the department.  Another person is Scott N. Schober. He is the President and CEO of Berkeley Varitronics Systems (BVS), a 45 year old New Jersey-based privately held company and leading provider of advanced, world-class wireless test and security solutions. Scott has developed cellular test instruments used primarily for cellular buildout throughout the U.S. with a recent focus on security solutions for cell phone detection tools, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and IoT used to enforce a â€˜no wirelessâ€™ security policy enforced in government, corporate, military, educational, correctional and law enforcement facilities around the world. Author: cybersecurityinvestor
Title: ğŸ”¥ğŸš€[ANN] BlockSafe Technologies - Securing the Blockchain Ecosystem ğŸ”¥ğŸš€
Body: Thank you and youâ€™re welcome, Team Blocksafe.  After watching the demo for CryptoDefender in addition to watching the interview describe what it does and what it prevents, I am convinced it will work for me and for many other people.  For my cryptocurrency wallet I use and prefer the software wallet Trust Wallet.  I store my credentials offline as well but I like how I just click the app and can see my balance, then transfer coins as need be.  Usually my transactions have consisted of browsing online and finding ERC20 tokens that I want to invest from 0-.5 ETH in.  At that point that I am ready to send ETH either simply zero for a self drop or up to .5 if a token has a dividend or revenue share feature that I like.  However when I send the Ethereum to the tokenâ€™s contract address I donâ€™t do much, if anything, to verify that the address I pasted in to the send ETH box on Trust Wallet is the same one that was given to me to do so.  It is inconvenient and time consuming to do so and essentially I just want to check that the gas fee is low then refresh and see my new ERC 20 tokens.   For this reason CryptoDefender will work for me and I am convinced many others use their wallets in this fashion as well.  I also predict a great need for ExchangeDefender and BlockchainDefender as well.  All the best in the journey, I definitely want to participate!
